verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O, I am a lady, my husband's a lord. A true knightly warrior, and God! I am bored.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The knights are called gentle and by birth they are. But I prefer minstrels, they're sweeter by far.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: He's fearless in melees, he's first at the chase. But when around ladies, falls flat on his face.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: He curses most roundly, and colorfully too. But ask him for soft words, he hasn't a clue.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: My lord is a true knight, fights rather than thinks. Excepting in battle, his swordsmanship stinks.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: My lord is crusading, I shall at home stay. And I'll not be pining while he is away.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: But my lord can trust me, I care not to roam. The lay of the minstrel will keep me at home!
